channel.title: Chelsea on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Chelsea on Table41NYC

item.title: Bonchon
item.description: Pretty bad and expensive. 10 pieces of bites fro $14, and it doesn’t even come with a drink.

item.title: CoBa
item.description: Their pho + banhmi combo $12.50 is OK for lunch.

item.title: Chuck and Blade
item.description: New York strip was so so. Cream of spinach was not good. There were lots of tendons in the meat. The lava cake dessert was good though.

item.title: Old Homestead
item.description: Got the aged rib eye for 2. Was surprisingly good. It’s not the best steakhouse in New York, but it’s not bad at all.

item.title: Thai Sliders
item.description: Good tom yum noodle soup for lunch. Actually pretty good overall pad thai and pad see ew staples.

item.title: Cafe Riazor
item.description: Spanish stuff. Cheap decent lunch.

item.title: Simply Hooked
item.description: This used to be in the Lower East Side, but I guess they set up shop in this Gansevoort Market area. It wasn’t that good. I prefer the A Salt & Battery place instead.

item.title: Hot N Juicy Crawfish
item.description: Got the soft shell poboy. Was decent for lunch. $17 for fries, drink, and a poboy. The normal stuff is rather expensive. Probably a $2-3 per pound markup compared to LA.

item.title: Roccos Pizza Joint
item.description: Got the cheesesteak, and I regret it. This place is eh.

item.title: Jun Men Ramen Bar
item.description: It’s similar to Shinsengumi. If in Chelsea and want ramen, Oramen is way better.

item.title: Oramen
item.description: This place is pretty good for the area. I like the miso.

item.title: Pizza Rollio
item.description: This place is just OK. Super gimmicky with the rolling pizza thing. Would rather have a slice than that. It’s like eating a super thin pizza that is malleable.

item.title: Detroit Pizza
item.description: The full name of this restaurant is “Lions and Tigers and Squares Detroit Pizza”. Obviously did not want that in the title of the post. Got the pepperoni and yellow peppers, and it was pretty good. Not too expensive… ~$12-14

item.title: Los Tacos
item.description: Pretty good for NYC. Still cannot compare to LA.

item.title: Miznon
item.description: This place sucks a lot, and it’s expensive. Food was just eh. I got the steak pita, and I was still very hungry. Overrated.

item.title: Dizengoff
item.description: This place was surprisingly good. The shakshooka and bread was really good. Too bad it’s CLOSED.

item.title: Coppelia
item.description: “Gourmet” lomo saltado is like paying $20 tacos. This is a ripoff and not worth the $20+. Good, but not great.

item.title: Momoya
item.description: Just ok. Cheap sushi. Don’t trust people’s palettes when they say this place is good.

item.title: Uma Temakeria
item.description: Terrible “sushi burrito” This place is CLOSED for obvious reasons.

item.title: Go Go Curry
item.description: Good lunch spot and fast. Cheap.

item.title: Lasagna Ristorante
item.description: Lots of food for lunch and just ok.

item.title: Dirty Bird to Go
item.description: This place sucks compared to KFC/Popeyes. Yeah I said it.

item.title: Westville
item.description: This fried chicken sandwich was a special served during lunch and was quite good. I think Westville’s normal menu seems bland and isn’t that great.

item.title: Le Singe Vert
item.description: Pretty good. Decent price. Don’t have much else to say I guess.

item.title: Shorty Tang
item.description: So so for lunch. Cash only. The sesame noodles was just ok.
